title: Dengue: Know about the symptoms, causes, and prevention

title: Why Don't So Many Tobacco Smokers Get Lung Cancer? New Study Has The Answer
description: Researchers found that mutations accumulated in the lungs of non-smokers as they aged with more mutations spotted in lung cells of smokers.
content:
We’ve often heard that smoking causes lung cancer, triggering DNA mutations in normal lungs but the same hasn’t really been scientifically proven.

title: Veganism for the win: Study links plant-based diet to lower risk of type-2 diabetes, know the other health benefits
description: If left unattended, type-2 diabetes may also spike risk of heart disease, kidney damage, blindness and nervous system damage.
content:
Several studies have associated a plant-based diet with healthier body weight, lower risk of inflammation and heart disease. Photo : iStock

title: If You’ve Got Diabetes, Pay Close Attention to Your Eyes
description: Diabetes can alter the health of blood vessels in the retina. However, they cause no symptoms in the early stages.
content:
If you’ve got diabetes, there are many things to be concerned about, but you might not consider your eyes.
But that could be a mistake. An annual eye exam may save your sight.

title: Researchers map first ever lung development after birth into late childhood
description: The map will help answer how lungs develop after taking their first breaths outside the womb and what cellular events and changes early in life give rise
content:
Scientists have constructed the first single-cell atlas of postnatal lung development in humans and mice.

title: Suffering From Muscle Degeneration? Regular Cycling Can Help
description: "Exercise really is medicine - we just need to get the message out," said Tarnopolsky, a professor of the departments of paediatrics and medicine at McMaster.
content:
A new study led by McMaster University has found that regular cycling can greatly improve mobility in patients with myotonic dystrophy (MD), which is a genetic disease that causes muscle degeneration.

title: New blood test can predict risk of stroke, heart failure four years before it happens
description: Researchers have developed a blood test that uses proteins and machine learning to predict the risk of heart disease four years in advance.
content: Researchers have developed a new blood test that can predict if someone is at high risk of a heart attack, stroke, or even dying from heart failure within the next four years. The test uses proteomics and machine learning to derive a 27-protein model... [2660 chars]
